description_txt: stated on September 12, 2009 in conservative blogs:
quote_txt: Photo of "tea party" protests shows crowd sprawling from Capitol to Washington Monument

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in response to President Obama's health care address to Congress:
quote_txt: The Democratic health care bill in the House would "create 53 new government bureaucracies."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2009 in a statement from the Minority Leader's office:
quote_txt: As a candidate, President Obama "declared that everyone deserves access to reproductive health care that includes abortion, and vowed that this 'right' would be at the heart of his health care reform plan if elected president."

description_txt: stated on August 24, 2009 in a message forwarded to many people:
quote_txt: A new bill "was written into the new health care reform initiative ensuring that Congress will be 100 percent exempt."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a "myth and fact" news release:
quote_txt: "Nothing in any of the Democrat bills would require individuals to verify their citizenship or identity prior to receiving taxpayer-subsidized benefits."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a speech to Congress:
quote_txt: Health reform will "give every American the same opportunity" to buy health insurance the way members of Congress do.

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in the audience at a joint session of Congress:
quote_txt: "You lie!" (in response to President Obama saying health reform would not insure illegal immigrants.)

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in an address to a joint session of Congress:
quote_txt: "It’s a plan that incorporates ideas from many of the people in this room tonight – Democrats and Republicans."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a speech to a joint session of Congress:
quote_txt: "The claim ... that we plan to set up panels of bureaucrats with the power to  kill off senior citizens ... is a lie, plain and simple."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a speech to Congress:
quote_txt: Preventive care "saves money."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2009 in a speech to Congress:
quote_txt: If you "already have health insurance through your job, or Medicare, or Medicaid, or the VA, nothing in this plan will require you or your employer to change the coverage or the doctor you have."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2009 in a Washington Post op-ed:
quote_txt: "Switzerland and the Netherlands . . . cover all their citizens using private insurers, and they do so for much less cost."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2009 in a column by the Texas Republican on the Web site of the Christian Coalition of America:
quote_txt: "The Obama Administration's own White House Council of Economic Advisers has estimated 4.7 million Americans will lose their jobs if the (health care) bill passes."

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2009 in his radio program:
quote_txt: Van Jones "is an avowed, self-avowed radical revolutionary communist."

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2009 in his television program:
quote_txt: Van Jones signed a petition indicating he "thinks the Bush administration blew up the World Trade Center and covered it up."

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2009 in his radio program:
quote_txt: The government is "going to have the right to get into your bank account with the health care bill and make transfers without you knowing it."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2009 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "We waterboard, incidentally, hundreds of our own military personnel. They waterboard themselves in training to toughen themselves up."

description_txt: stated on August 26, 2009 in a letter to principals:
quote_txt: A scheduled speech by President Barack Obama will be "the first time an American president has spoken directly to the nation's school children about persisting and succeeding in school."

description_txt: stated on September 2, 2009 in an editorial:
quote_txt: "Cap-and-trade is wildly unpopular with Americans."

description_txt: stated on August 13, 2009 in an op-ed in the Washington Examiner:
quote_txt: "It took Obama six months to pick out a family dog," but he's "cramming health care reform down the country's throat in a fraction of that time."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2009 in an op-ed published in the Huffington Post:
quote_txt: "Scientists project that the Arctic will be ice-free in the summer of 2013."

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2009 in a fundraising e-mail:
quote_txt: Over the past few months, we've learned that "we just can't count on the media to debunk" lies about health insurance reform.

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: Schoolchildren across the nation "will be forced to watch the president justify his plans for government-run health care, banks, and automobile companies, increasing taxes on those who create jobs, and racking up more debt than any other president."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2009 in CNN's Lou Dobbs Tonight:
quote_txt: "Every survey shows strong satisfaction with private coverage."

description_txt: stated on August 30, 2009 in an op-ed in The Washington Post:
quote_txt: "Since World War II, only Gerald Ford and Bill Clinton have had worse ratings after seven months than President Obama."

description_txt: stated on August 25, 2009 in an interview on the Rachel Maddow Show:
quote_txt: "All the really great programs in American history, Social Security, was done without Republicans. Medicare was done without Republican support until the last vote where they realized they had to get on board."

description_txt: stated on August 25, 2009 in an interview on "Fox and Friends":
quote_txt: "Under the plan, for the first five years your employer not only has to keep the coverage, but you can't migrate to the public plan."

description_txt: stated on August 10, 2009 in an interview with Rachel Maddow:
quote_txt: "It's costing every American who is insured $1,100 to pick up the cost of uncompensated care that goes on at the emergency room."

description_txt: stated on August 25, 2009 in a radio broadcast:
quote_txt: "President Obama . . . wants to mandate circumcision."

description_txt: stated on August 24, 2009 in Fox News Channel's On the Record With Greta Van Susteren:
quote_txt: "Medicare has at least $80 billion worth of fraud a year. That's a full 20 percent of every dollar that's spent on Medicare goes to fraud."
